text:
In 2.2.8, the following RewriteRule works correctly:
RewriteRule ^/(.*)$ http://domain.com/foo?foo=bar [proxy,noescape,last,qsappend]

In 2.2.9, when the request is proxied, the query parameters are stripped, and the foo=bar portion disappears. Also, all GET parameters passed in by the HTTP client disappear as well.

To reiterate: this code has worked in apache versions up to 2.2.8. In 2.2.9 something changed. This bug is severe, and makes mod_rewrite completely unusable.
creator: mdierolf@financialcontent.com

text: A fix for this is already in trunk and proposed for backport (r670072, http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=rev&revision=670072). Please use the following patch to fix this: http://people.apache.org/~tdonovan/diffs/mod_rewrite_proxy_esc_2.2.x.diff
creator: rpluem@apache.org

text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 45247 ***
creator: rpluem@apache.org
